document_data.caption: A map showing the River Sur in northern Thay.
document_data.name: River Sur
document_data.mainbody:
The '''River Sur''' was a small river in the [[Unapproachable East]] that flowed down from a spring on the northern face of the [[First Escarpment]] of the [[Thayan Plateau]]. Its waters flowed northeast along the borders of the [[Thay]]an tharchs [[Eltabbar (tharch)|Eltabbar]] and [[Surthay (tharch)|Surthay]], past the [[Surmarsh]], before opening into [[Lake Mulsantir]].

The river formed a border between the nations of Thay and [[Thesk]].
document_data.Description: The River Sur was narrow and fast at its source but became quite wide a short distance later, slowing in speed. The shallow waters that wound past the Surmarsh were infested with disease-carrying insects.
document_data.Notable locations: A few Thayan settlements dotted the southern shores of the River Sur. They were seldom visited by Thayan tax collectors and generally left to their independence. The Theskian fishing settlement of [[Tezir|Tezir-on-the-Marsh]] was nestled in the lands where the river fed Lake Mulsantir.
